I am Holly Woodford
I’m here to listen, to act, and to be a voice you can count on.
I'm standing to be your Labour councillor because fairness has always been at the heart of who I am.
I care deeply about standing up for people who are too often left out, overlooked, or unheard.
As a social entrepreneur and women's health advocate, I’ve dedicated my work to fixing a system that too often overlooks the most in need.
For me, fairness starts with making sure our own community gets the support and resources it needs. That’s why I’m standing in this election.
I want to use my skills, expertise and strong relationships with the Labour MP for Broxtowe Juliet Campbell and the Labour Mayor of the East Midlands Claire Ward to get our roads fixed, rebuild our local NHS and keep our amenities open from recycling centres to local libraries.
I’ll bring the same energy, commitment, and determination I’ve shown in my work to getting things done here, for all of us.
Fixing potholes
My Pledges to you:
Our roads have crumbled under years of Conservative neglect — and Nottinghamshire is now the 4th worst in the country for repairs.
Labour is investing £1.6 billion to fix roads and fill millions of potholes. With a Labour-run County Council, I’ll make sure Bramcote and Beeston North gets its fair share.
I’ll hold the council to account and make fixing our streets a top priority — because safe, reliable roads shouldn’t be too much to ask.

Fix our roads
I will make fixing our potholes properly my primary goal.

Fix the finances
I will oppose expensive vanity projects like the £23 million new County Council HQ and ensure the funds go to the most in need.

I am Holly Woodford
I’m here to listen, to act, and to be a voice you can count on.
I am Holly Woodford, I live in Denison Street and I am your local Labour Candidate for Bramcote & Beeston North. I'm standing to be your Labour councillor because I care deeply about standing up for people who are too often left out, overlooked, or unheard.
As a social entrepreneur and women's health advocate, I’ve dedicated my work to fixing a system that too often overlooks the most in need.
My role as a councillor isn't to be opinionated. It isn't to be dogged or come with a fixed mindset on key issues. It is to listen, engage and take forward the issues that most affect residents.
I want to use my skills, expertise and strong relationships with the Labour MP for Broxtowe Juliet Campbell and the Labour Mayor of the East Midlands Claire Ward to get our roads fixed, rebuild our local NHS and keep our amenities open from recycling centres to local libraries.
With big decisions ahead for Nottinghamshire I would be a highly effective County Councillors with the skills and competencies to fight for the needs of our community
Fixing potholes
My pledges to you:
Our roads have crumbled under years of Conservative neglect — and Nottinghamshire is now one of the worst in the country for repairs.
Labour is investing £1.6 billion to fix roads and fill millions of potholes. With a Labour-run County Council, I’ll make sure Bramcote and Beeston North gets its fair share.
I will make fixing our streets a top priority — because safe, reliable roads shouldn’t be too much to ask.
